Author: staunch
Content:
Reddit too, also failed there as far as I can tell: http://ads.reddit.com/

This doesn't mean it wouldn't work across a large set of sites though. Aggregating responses and correlating them should produce really effective targeting.

Author: s_baar
Content: I don't have any experience, but this looks like a solid plan. If you mean what you say, I'm sure you'll be fine. Just keep focused!

Author: menloparkbum
Content: You could always just build a bot that adds 20000 MySpace accounts per day in order to ensure that MySpace stays ahead.

Author: menloparkbum
Content: My cynical side remembers doing all the grunt work for 18 months at my first startup and then getting sacked to free up my unvested stock for the hopeless flotilla of "key hires" who proceeded to sink the company.

Author: asdflkj
Content:
Isn't it more fair to compare microprocessors to server-based applications, and not just to HTML with javascript, which is only one way to do it? In practice, it is the only way right now, if one wants users, but considering how painful and limiting it is, will things stay this way?

Unfortunately, I couldn't RTFA because it's down.

Author: rms
Title: $100 + $12.95 a month for an easy to use, environmentally friendly Linux PC
Content:
I like the business model and this review: http://news.digitaltrends.com/talkback202.html says that the overall experience with this box is great.

Do you think they will be successful?

Author: dood
Content: The scope of the experiment is so narrow that I wouldn't draw any conclusions based on this, unless I was making a cheaply-designed, SEO-driven, diet-pill selling website. Even then, the difference could be attributed to poor design (irrespective of width).
